junit.textui
Class SelectiveTestRunner

java.lang.Object
  junit.runner.BaseTestRunner
      junit.textui.TestRunner
          junit.textui.SelectiveTestRunner
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.TestListener
public class SelectiveTestRunner
extends junit.textui.TestRunner

A command line based tool to run selected tests, prioritize test selection, support tracing of instrumented subjects, and perform automatic differencing between test runs. 

 java junit.textui.SelectiveTestRunner [-wait] [-sID <IDs> | -sName <names>]
    [-o <outputdir>] [-d <diffdir>] [-t <options>] [-p] TestCaseClass
SelectiveTestRunner expects the name of a TestCase class as argument. If this class defines a static suite method it will be invoked and the returned test is run. Otherwise all the methods starting with "test" having no arguments are run.

When the wait command line argument is given to SelectiveTestRunner waits until the users types RETURN.

Version:
04/24/2006
Author:
Alex Kinneer

selectedIDs

protected int[] selectedIDs
Array containing selected test numbers. If non-null, selectedNames array must be null.

fPrinter

Test listener which prints outputs, and performs differencing and tracing if appropriate.

dispatcher

protected sofya.ed.structural.JUnitEventDispatcher dispatcher
Event dispatcher used to trace instrumented test cases, if appropriate.

ufg

protected UniverseFileGenerator ufg
Module which generates a universe file which can be used to run the tests in the test suite in the same order as the current run (in a less efficient manner).

displayOnly

protected boolean displayOnly
Activated by '-names' option. When true, the runner simply prints the names and numbers of the test cases encountered without running them.

countOnly

protected boolean countOnly
Activated by '-count' option. When true, the runner simply prints the total number of tests cases found in the test suite.

prioritizing

protected boolean prioritizing
Activated by '-p' option. When true, the runner operates in priorization mode and will run tests in the literal order specified.

classLvl

protected boolean classLvl

stdin

protected static final java.io.BufferedReader stdin
Convenience reader for System.in.

Throws UnsupportedOperationException. Use runAndWait(Test,int[]) or runAndWait(Test,String[]) instead.

run

public static junit.framework.TestResult run(junit.framework.Test test,
                                             int[] selectedIDs)
Runs the specified tests from a test suite and collects the results, selecting tests by number. This method can be used to start a test run from your program. 
 public static void main (String[] args) {
     test.textui.TestRunner.run(suite(), selectedTestIDs);
 }

Parameters:
test - Test suite from which to run selected tests.
selectedIDs - List of tests to be run. The order of entries in this list is considered important if prioritization is activated.

run

public static junit.framework.TestResult run(junit.framework.Test test,
                                             java.lang.String[] selectedNames)
Runs the specified tests from a test suite and collects the results, selecting tests by name. This method can be used to start a test run from your program. 
 public static void main (String[] args) {
     test.textui.TestRunner.run(suite(), selectedTestNames);
 }

WARNING: It is possible for a test suite to invoke a test method multiple times at different points (presumably on different inputs). Selecting by name will cause all invocations to be selected, as each is considered a distinct test case. As this may not be expected behavior, the test runner will emit a warning when the number of tests run exceeds the number in the selection list. Selection by ID will never cause more than one test to be selected per list entry.

Parameters:
test - Test suite from which to run selected tests.
selectedNames - List of tests to be run. The order of entries in this list is considered important if prioritization is activated.

setSelectedIDs

public void setSelectedIDs(int[] selectedIDs)
Selects the tests to be run with a list of IDs. Deactivates selection by name and destroys the list of selected test names.

Parameters:
selectedIDs - List of IDs corresponding to the tests to be run.

setSelectedNames

public void setSelectedNames(java.lang.String[] selectedNames)
Selects the tests to be run with a list of names. Deactivates selection by ID and destroys the list of selected test IDs.

Parameters:
selectedIDs - List of names corresponding to the tests to be run.

setPrinter

public void setPrinter(SelectionResultPrinter printer)
Sets the output printer to the specified SelectionResultPrinter. The SelectionResultPrinter is also responsible for tracing and differencing, when those options are enabled.

Parameters:
printer - SelectionResultPrinter to be used for handling test outputs.
